abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Sichuan Urban
            Environment Project in China were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: a practical approach to balance
            the Bank's priority for institutional development with
            the Government's priority for expanding wastewater
            coverage and service levels is necessary. As investment
            financing becomes less important to China, the Bank's
            future focus should shift to value addition, through
            programs to transfer knowledge of management systems and
            procedures. The objectives and priorities of Sichuan
            Province (SP) were different from those of the Bank. SP gave
            priority to honoring the agreements made with the central
            government to expand municipal wastewater treatment to
            reduce pollution discharges to the river system. An
            experienced Project Management Office staffed with a
            full-time Director and qualified technical staff, and
            supported by an experienced project management consultants
            are important ingredients for smooth project implementation.
